titles.title: We Give Thee But Thine Own

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: We give Thee but Thine own, Whate'er the gift may be; All that we have is Thine alone, A trust, O Lord, from Thee.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: May we Thy bounties thus As stewards true receive, And gladly, as Thou blessest us, To Thee our firstfruits give.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: O hearts are bruised and dead, And homes are bare and cold, And lambs for whom the Shepherd bled Are straying from the fold.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: To comfort and to bless, To find a balm for woe, To tend the lone and fatherless Is angels' work below.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: The captive to release, To God the lost to bring, To teach the way of life and peace? It is a Christlike thing.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
And we believe Thy Word,
Though dim our faith may be;
Whate'er for Thine we do, O Lord,
We do it unto Thee.
